{{Use Australian English|date=September 2011}} '''Lee Sheppard''' (born 22 August 1974) is an [[Australia]]n [[cartoonist]] and animator. He currently resides in [[Sydney]], [[Australia]] and is developing and writing projects for animated film & television.
==Personal== Sheppard was born in [[Paddington, New South Wales|Paddington]], [[New South Wales]] to Barry Ernest Sheppard and Margaret Crichton-Reid.
==Education== Sheppard spent 2 years studying Fine Arts at Paddington Art School under tuition by [[Stephen Wesley Gorton]] in 1993, then Classical Advanced Animation studies at Enmore Design Centre in 1995, and later on Screenwriting for Children's Animated Television Series at the [http://www.aftrs.edu.au/ Australian Film Television Radio School (AFTRS)] in 2007.<ref>[http://www.toonstudio.com.au/about.php Toon Studio :: About<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080226234153/http://www.toonstudio.com.au/about.php |date=2008-02-26 }}</ref>
==Career== Sheppard's early career began while drawing political comics for Fairfax community newspapers in his late teens. He then worked as an animator on numerous animated children's TV series such as Wicked! Gloria's House and Crocadoo.<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2698435/ Lee Sheppard (II)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He was also the comic strip artist for political cartoon,<ref>[http://www.nma.gov.au/exhibitions/past_exhibitions/behind_the_lines/about_the_artists National Museum of Australia - About the artists<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Cactus Island, a strip based on the multi-award winning radio show [http://www.cactus.com.au/ "How Green was my Cactus"]. Sheppard used the pseudonym D. Denko instead of his real name in this comic strip. Cactus Island was syndicated through [http://www.auspacmedia.com.au/ Auspac Media], which was published in regional newspapers across Australia between 1999 to 2006.
In 1994 he was nominated as a member<ref>[http://www.cartoonists.org.au/membersearch/2005/07/lee_sheppard.php ACA Member Profile Search: Lee Sheppard<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706124433/http://cartoonists.org.au/membersearch/2005/07/lee_sheppard.php |date=2011-07-06 }}</ref> by [[Jim Russell (cartoonist)|Jim Russell]] (The Potts) to join the [http://www.cartoonists.org.au/ Australian Cartoonists' Association] (ACA). Lee was on the committee for 5 years, where he has held the positions of Secretary, NSW State Vice President and Deputy President. And in 1998 he was again nominated by Jim Russell to the ranks of the [http://www.reuben.org/ National Cartoonists Society] in the United States.<ref>[http://www.leesheppard.com/about About (Lee Sheppard)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Sheppard is also a member of the [http://www.afi.org.au/ Australian Film Institute] and [http://www.awg.com.au/ Australian Writer's Guild].
==Awards== In 2003, Sheppard won the [[Stanley Award]]'s [http://www.cartoonists.org.au/stanleys.htm Best Cartoon on the Night]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }},<ref>http://www.cartoonists.org.au/stanleys.htm{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> in Ettalong.
